result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tony Lee Rich

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on February 22, 2023 at 01:30 pm.

1:14 PM and recalled at 1:31 PM Defendant Tony Lee Rich appeared by phone.  Attorney Ryan W O'Hara appeared by video for Tony Lee Rich.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant's attorney, reading waived. Defendant's attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 12, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
1:29 PM Defendant did not appear. Court orders $500.00 warrant on defendant's nonappearance. Matter recalled at 1:32 PM Defendant Tony Lee Rich appeared by phone.  Prosecuting attorney Emmeline Lee appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Court cancels warrant previously ordered. Matter continued for defendant to contact public defenders office.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Activity: Initial Appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

3:32 PM Defendant Tony Lee Rich appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Taylor E Klokow appeared by video for Tony Lee Rich.  Prosecuting attorney Mason C Braunschweig appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Court orders $1000 signature bond with conditions: Defendant to have no contact with Festival Foods or Ronald Patton; Level II Pretrial services
No contact with co-defendant Ronald Patten. No contact with Festival Foods.
Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Risk Report
